intro: Espeletia liscanoana, commonly known as the Liscanoan heath, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Colombia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky and well-drained soils, adapting to the harsh conditions of its mountainous habitat. Its foliage consists of dense, narrow leaves that help reduce water loss in arid environments. Espeletia liscanoana plays a significant role in its ecosystem by providing habitat and food for various local fauna.
